commit_message:
enforcement logic refactored

In keystone/common/controller.py, the enforcement logic was inside the
'protected' and filterprotected wrapperw, which is used to annotate
controller methods. This change extracts the enforcement logic to its
own method, making it possible to be called without having the
'protected' annotation.  It also unifies the two annotations.

This is specially useful when a single method needs to apply
enforcement depending on the parameters. Take change [1] as example,
which needed to write [create|get|list|update|delete]_domain_role
methods only to match the current standard using that annotation.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/262078

Change-Id: I03d7c997441941761a879a7541e5273e0d7e300d

commit_message:
Revert "Adjust logrotate configuration to use date suffix"

Actually this is not covering all requirements described in the bug-report, such as setting dateext for logrotate.conf

This reverts commit 349182fa7e91f6f2f74689f6d4b91950e9579aa0.

Change-Id: Ic36805a187eb1f5b7243356af860d5c145f9c91e

commit_message:
conf: Deprecate 'remap_vbd_dev' option

This is required for a decrepit version of Ubuntu. Just remove it.

Change-Id: Ica2c08fc00abb70d6ff7955bfe2b9a66e725f437
Implements: bp centralize-config-options-ocata

commit_message:
Improve consistency in serial_console

Removed sections that are no longer required [1].
Updated header flags
Improved indentation
Moved vars to list
Chnged IntOpt to PortOpt where required
Changed StrOpt to URIOpt where required
Changed "Interdependencies..." to "Related options" which is more common

Blueprint centralize-config-options-ocata

Change-Id: Icaef9a42460becd5c65ee809e33fbd044b34f763

subject: libvirt: Rewrite _test_finish_migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-04 11:51:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f9a03f37f60ec78ab3fde94d6aa6853b2464baf4', 'message': "libvirt: Rewrite _test_finish_migration

Rewrite the finish_migration tests in anticipation of a major update.
Apart from switching from mox to mock, the principal change is that
we're now mocking at the backend boundary rather than the
_create_image boundary, which means we can test what we do to
individual disks. In the updated finish_migration we no longer use
_create_image, so making this change in advance allows us to see the
functional changes more clearly.

We also pull a convenient set of mocks out of _test_rescue and reuse
them here.

Change-Id: I439a5cfb054fa05ce156f7bf1d24cc8794d561e1
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-04 14:09:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8787a669dc1b60e95f55cf6767ce765a016541b6', 'message': "libvirt: Rewrite _test_finish_migration

Rewrite the finish_migration tests in anticipation of a major update.
Apart from switching from mox to mock, the principal change is that
we're now mocking at the backend boundary rather than the
_create_image boundary, which means we can test what we do to
individual disks. In the updated finish_migration we no longer use
_create_image, so making this change in advance allows us to see the
functional changes more clearly.

We also pull a convenient set of mocks out of _test_rescue and reuse
them here.

Change-Id: I439a5cfb054fa05ce156f7bf1d24cc8794d561e1
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-04 16:48:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/dc45d3df3173366a8a11f0687a252a242be4499d', 'message': "libvirt: Rewrite _test_finish_migration

Rewrite the finish_migration tests in anticipation of a major update.
Apart from switching from mox to mock, the principal change is that
we're now mocking at the backend boundary rather than the
_create_image boundary, which means we can test what we do to
individual disks. In the updated finish_migration we no longer use
_create_image, so making this change in advance allows us to see the
functional changes more clearly.

We also pull a convenient set of mocks out of _test_rescue and reuse
them here.

commit_message:
libvirt: Rewrite _test_finish_migration

Rewrite the finish_migration tests in anticipation of a major update.
Apart from switching from mox to mock, the principal change is that
we're now mocking at the backend boundary rather than the
_create_image boundary, which means we can test what we do to
individual disks. In the updated finish_migration we no longer use
_create_image, so making this change in advance allows us to see the
functional changes more clearly.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: I439a5cfb054fa05ce156f7bf1d24cc8794d561e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/59/337159/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @staticmethod @contextlib.contextmanager def _get_guest_xml_mocks(): # A set of mocks which allow us to execute _get_guest_xml without # touching the DB, but still get a useful result. with test.nested( mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, '_set_host_enabled'), mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, '_build_device_metadata', mock.Mock(return_value=None)), mock.patch('nova.api.metadata.base.InstanceMetadata') ): yield @mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, '_inject_data') @mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, 'get_info') @mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, '_create_domain_and_network') @mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, '_disk_raw_to_qcow2') def _test_finish_migration(self, mock_raw_to_qcow2, mock_create_domain_and_network, mock_get_info, mock_inject_data, power_on=True, resize_instance=False): if power_on: state = power_state.RUNNING else: state = power_state.SHUTDOWN mock_get_info.return_value = hardware.InstanceInfo(state=state) instance = self._create_instance( {'config_drive': str(True), 'task_state': task_states.RESIZE_FINISH}, flavor_params={'swap': 500}) disks = {} with test.nested( mock_backend(disks=disks), self._get_guest_xml_mocks() ): # Assert that we converted the root and ephemeral disks convert_calls = [mock.call('/test/disk'), mock.call('/test/disk.local'), mock.call('/test/disk.swap')] mock_raw_to_qcow2.assert_has_calls(convert_calls, any_order=True) # Implicitly assert that we did not convert the config disk self.assertEqual(len(convert_calls), mock_raw_to_qcow2.call_count) # Assert that we called cache() on kernel, ramdisk, disk, # and disk.local. # This results in creation of kernel, ramdisk, and disk.swap. # This results in backing file check and resize of disk and disk.local. for name in ('kernel', 'ramdisk', 'disk', 'disk.local', 'disk.swap'): self.assertTrue(disks[name].cache.called, 'cache() not called for %s' % name) # Assert that we created a snapshot for the root disk root_disk = disks['disk'] root_disk.create_snap.assert_called_once() # Assert that we didn't import a config disk # Note that some path currently creates a config disk object, # but only uses it for an exists() check. Therefore the object may # exist, but shouldn't have been imported. if 'disk.config' in disks: disks['disk.config'].import_file.assert_not_called() # We shouldn't be injecting data during migration mock_inject_data.assert_not_called() # NOTE(mdbooth): If we wanted to check the generated xml, we could # insert a hook here mock_create_domain_and_network.assert_called_once_with( mock.ANY, mock.ANY, instance, [], mock.ANY, block_device_info=None, power_on=power_on, vifs_already_plugged=True) self._test_finish_migration(resize_instance=True) self._test_finish_migration() self._test_finish_migration(power_on=False) mock_backend(disks=disks, exists=exists), self._get_guest_xml_mocks() ) as (mock_create_domain, mock_ignored, mock_ignored):
deleted_lines: def _test_finish_migration(self, power_on, resize_instance=False): powered_on = power_on self.fake_create_domain_called = False create_image_called = [False] def fake_to_xml(context, instance, network_info, disk_info, image_meta=None, rescue=None, block_device_info=None, write_to_disk=False): return "" def fake_plug_vifs(instance, network_info): pass def fake_create_image(context, inst, disk_mapping, suffix='', disk_images=None, network_info=None, block_device_info=None, inject_files=True, fallback_from_host=None): self.assertFalse(inject_files) create_image_called[0] = True def fake_create_domain_and_network( context, xml, instance, network_info, disk_info, block_device_info=None, power_on=True, reboot=False, vifs_already_plugged=False, post_xml_callback=None): self.fake_create_domain_called = True self.assertEqual(powered_on, power_on) self.assertTrue(vifs_already_plugged) def fake_enable_hairpin(): pass def fake_execute(*args, **kwargs): pass def fake_get_info(instance): if powered_on: return hardware.InstanceInfo(state=power_state.RUNNING) else: return hardware.InstanceInfo(state=power_state.SHUTDOWN) self.stubs.Set(self.drvr, '_get_guest_xml', fake_to_xml) self.stubs.Set(self.drvr, 'plug_vifs', fake_plug_vifs) self.stubs.Set(self.drvr, '_create_image', fake_create_image) self.stubs.Set(self.drvr, '_create_domain_and_network', fake_create_domain_and_network) self.stubs.Set(nova.virt.libvirt.guest.Guest, 'enable_hairpin', fake_enable_hairpin) self.stubs.Set(utils, 'execute', fake_execute) fw = base_firewall.NoopFirewallDriver() self.stubs.Set(self.drvr, 'firewall_driver', fw) self.stubs.Set(self.drvr, 'get_info', fake_get_info) instance = self._create_instance({'config_drive': str(True)}) with mock.patch.object(self.drvr, '_disk_raw_to_qcow2', autospec=True) as mock_raw_to_qcow2: # Assert that we converted the root and ephemeral disks convert_calls = [mock.call('/test/disk'), mock.call('/test/disk.local')] mock_raw_to_qcow2.assert_has_calls(convert_calls, any_order=True) # Implicitly assert that we did not convert the config disk self.assertEqual(len(convert_calls), mock_raw_to_qcow2.call_count) self.assertTrue(self.fake_create_domain_called) self._test_finish_migration(True, resize_instance=True) self._test_finish_migration(True) self._test_finish_migration(False) # Mocks to avoid hitting the DB @mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, '_set_host_enabled', mock.Mock()) @mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, '_build_device_metadata', mock.Mock(return_value=None)) @mock.patch('nova.api.metadata.base.InstanceMetadata', mock.MagicMock()) mock_backend(disks=disks, exists=exists) ) as (mock_create_domain, mock_ignored):

commit_message:
conf: Move consoleauth options to a group

Rename them to remove unnecessary prefixes. This allows us to remove
the final TODO.

Change-Id: Iede35bbbf0124cfc7521cb91dda323b4d425e630

commit_message:
Add container_sync_interval tempest config.

This commit adds configuration for a new option added to tempest on [1],
which allows to configure the deletion timeout for containers in
object-storage.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/405483/

Change-Id: I422bec873b7380c34808d376b926b3d8746366db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/17/406117/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Object Storage if is_service_enabled swift; then # Swift might take some longer time to synchronize the deletion of the # container in HA environments. iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG object-storage container_sync_interval 2 fi

commit_message:
Add resource for DHCP Agent.

This patch introduces resource for DHCP agent in the OpenStack SDK. This
is used in implementing neutron DHCP agents commands in the OpenStack
client.

The equivalent neutron commands to be implemented in OSC:

- dhcp-agent-list-hosting-net
- dhcp-agent-network-add
- dhcp-agent-network-remove
- net-list-on-dhcp-agent

To implement the above commands in OSC, their respective resource in SDK
is needed. This patch introduces those.

Partially Implements: blueprint network-dhcp-adv-commands

Change-Id: Idebd3cd4b445a244962484923aa6cc47ebd8deed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/02/387602/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class NetworkDHCPAgent(resource.Resource): resource_key = 'agent' resources_key = 'agents' base_path = '/networks/%(network_id)s/dhcp-agents' service = network_service.NetworkService() # capabilities allow_list = True # Properties #: The administrative state of the network, which is up ``True`` or #: down ``False``. *Type: bool* is_admin_state_up = resource.prop('admin_state_up', type=bool) #: Whether or not the network agent is alive. #: *Type: bool* is_alive = resource.prop('alive', type=bool) #: The host the agent is running on. host = resource.prop('host') #: The ID of the attached network. network_id = resource.prop('network_id')

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 01:39:16.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/40d73a0b585fde9c065fb069d7a31c4717c8887d', 'message': "Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should
call 'raise' without any arguments because it shows

Change-Id: I3ec3680debbfad7c06f2251396e0e8e4e3df6c50
"}]
commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should
call 'raise' without any arguments because it shows
the place where an exception occured initially instead
of place where the exception re-raised

Change-Id: I3ec3680debbfad7c06f2251396e0e8e4e3df6c50

so we should switch to use these files.

added_lines: --- fixes: - Prior to Newton volumes encrypted by the CryptsetupEncryptor and LuksEncryptor encryption providers used a mangled passphrase stripped of leading zeros per hexadecimal. When opening encrypted volumes LuksEncryptor now attempts to replace these mangled passphrases if detected while CryptsetupEncryptor simply uses the mangled passphrase. The LuksEncryptor workaround will be removed in a future release of Nova once it is safe to assume that all volumes formatted by it prior to Newton have had their mangled passphrases replaced using this workaround.

commit_message:
Remove redundant req setting

In the test class VolumeAttachTestsV21, many tests have almost same
req setting. That seems redundant.
This patch removes them by merging it into setUp().

Change-Id: I33fb7436b1d74367654e948e88e433b07f2ce40d

commit_message:
Remove _set_up_controller() from attach tests

_set_up_controller() was used for switching a controller between
legacy v2 api code and v2.1 api code. Now the legacy code has been
removed, so the method is not necessary at all.
This patch removes it for the cleanup.

Change-Id: I3641d1d0e08bce405ff59b942789a6069c17d9cd

commit_message:
Add block_device_mapping_v2.uuid to api-ref

The sample of block_device_mapping_v2 contains uuid as a parameter
but there is not any explanation of the parameter.
This patch adds it to api-ref.

The following is for explaining the parameter from the code.

  As the following code, source_type is "image" and api_dict["image_id"]
  can be glance image-id on the sample case.

  https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/block_device.py#L197
    api_dict[source_type + '_id'] = device_uuid

  The "image_id" is used for getting image metadata from Glance:

  https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/api.py#L1072
    image_id = bdm['image_id']
    image_meta = self.image_api.get(context, image_id)

Change-Id: I83badab07446c2b1e55cc3b29a3ba9476efc179d

commit_message:
Add resize_server in compute.base

This is to add a common function resize_server in compute.base,
to accomplish the procedure of resize and confirm resize until
finally the server becomes ACTIVE. This procedure appears in
several testcases and so can be simplified by using the common
function.

Change-Id: I6661d3415b4b183d785f05301dcbdd3e63fb51b9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/60/402360/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.resize_server(server['id'], self.flavor_ref_alt, disk_config='AUTO') self.resize_server(server['id'], self.flavor_ref_alt, disk_config='MANUAL')
deleted_lines: self.client.resize_server(server['id'], self.flavor_ref_alt, disk_config='AUTO') waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.client, server['id'], 'VERIFY_RESIZE') self.client.confirm_resize_server(server['id']) waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.client, server['id'], 'ACTIVE') self.client.resize_server(server['id'], self.flavor_ref_alt, disk_config='MANUAL') waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.client, server['id'], 'VERIFY_RESIZE') self.client.confirm_resize_server(server['id']) waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.client, server['id'], 'ACTIVE')

commit_message:
clean up image choices and help text

Use choices for image set and image create commands, this aligns
with our use of choices in networking commands.

Also update the help text to match that of the networking
commands, where we iterate through the options.

Related-Bug: 1635518
Change-Id: Ib4c66b06e07f1d4e5bfe1b74053f2215cccad890
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/96/395796/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DISK_CHOICES = ["ami", "ari", "aki", "vhd", "vmdk", "raw", "qcow2", "vhdx", "vdi", "iso"] choices=DISK_CHOICES, help=_("Image disk format. The supported options are: " "ami, ari, aki, vhd, vmdk, raw, qcow2, vhdx, vdi, and iso. " "The default format is: raw") choices=DISK_CHOICES, help=_("Image disk format. The supported options are: " "ami, ari, aki, vhd, vmdk, raw, qcow2, vhdx, vdi, and iso.")
deleted_lines: help=_("Image disk format " "(default: %s)") % DEFAULT_DISK_FORMAT, help=_("Image disk format " "(default: %s)") % DEFAULT_DISK_FORMAT,

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/73cd325f82163cdca702c317561c0464\n'

Change-Id: I6efa23d7fc3b921ad71a76a3699197b716cd3bed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector-specs refs/changes/94/402494/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use serviceEndpoint compatible with versions

This patch adds a more flexible selection of version in AbstractService.
A version will be selected if it's compatible with the 'supportedVersions'.
Example:
  supportedVersions = ['v3.1'];
  All minor versions above 3.1 will be compatible (3.1.2, 3.2, 3.3 etc)
  However 4.x will not be compatible

Change-Id: Icd540449ebf6a09d9bb7e1d25a85e2dbe787c5a4

commit_message:
Integration tests for device role tagging

This adds an API test that tests device role tagging. It boots an
instance with tagged network interfaces and block devices and makes
sure that the tags appear correctly in the metadata, both via the API
and in the configdrive.

Change-Id: Ica92b771fc04891ad231967470f8b0ade7d2dead
Implements blueprint virt-device-role-tagging
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/20/305120/36 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2016, Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.scenario import manager from tempest.common.utils import data_utils class TestDeviceTagging(manager.NetworkScenarioTest): def create_networks_volumes_and_server(self): network_one, _, _ = self.create_networks() network_two, _, _ = self.create_networks() self.check_networks((network_one, network_two)) volume_one = self.create_volume() volume_two = self.create_volume() # create_volume does its own checks self.create_server( name=data_utils.rand_name('device-tagging-server') networks=[{'uuid': network_one.id, 'tag': 'network-one'}, {'uuid': network_two.id, 'tag': 'network-two'}], block_device_mapping_v2=[{'uuid': volume_one.id, 'source_type': 'volume', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'boot_index': 1, 'tag': 'volume-one'}, {'uuid': volume_two.id, 'source_type': 'volume', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'boot_index': 1, 'tag': 'volume-two'}] wait_until='ACTIVE') def check_network(self, networks): seen_nets = self._list_networks() seen_names = [n['name'] for n in seen_nets] seen_ids = [n['id'] for n in seen_nets] for n in networks: self.assertIn(n.name, seen_names) self.assertIn(n.id, seen_ids) def test_device_tagging(self): self.create_networks_volumes_and_server()

commit_message:
Exclude ct and cluster names from scenarios

Added ability to run scenarios without cluster templates and cluster
names

Change-Id: Ifba77ba8a40000d026280ebd5f8ba5a374559646

commit_message:
Rework handling requirements for functional tests

Switch to just pulling test-requirements from ironic-inspector directly.
This reverts adding "oslotest" which was only pulled by ironic-inspector
functional tests.

Note: the cherry-pick to stable/newton also updates the branch used.

Change-Id: Ib25a6c9e5428526cbd080a6d6d36ce9b5341a768
(cherry picked from commit 7c2ee30a87a10e017eef8728d9d17fe11c014a05)

commit_message:
Fix non-deterministic suffix updates in hashes.pkl

Right now the do_listdir option was set on every 10th replication run.
Due to the randomness of the job listing this might update a given
partition much less often than expected, for example with 1000
partitions per replicator only every ~70th run.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <cschwede@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1634967
Closes-Bug: 1644807
Change-Id: Ib5c9dd17e40150450ec57a728ae8652fbc730af6

commit_message:
Format the nodes list in openstack overcloud delete node

The current command will output something like the following:

  deleting nodes [u'UUID-UUID'] from stack overcloud

This change adds simple string formatting so that a raw Python list
isn't displayed.

Change-Id: Ibf8bc40f0c45be60e869c5ab3d99d892e24f8a94
Closes-Bug: #1633449

commit_message:
Revert "Adjust logrotate configuration to use date suffix"

Actually this is not covering all requirements described in the bug-report, such as setting dateext for logrotate.conf

This reverts commit fdcf1dd6369aeb3937e41eb80396ac1450560392.

Change-Id: I173d057b925217cc9d72338498ed1fc2b52aa33c

commit_message:
Add node provision state change notification

This patch adds node provision state changes notifications,
event types are:
"baremetal.node.provision_set.{start, end, success, error}"
Developer documentation updated.

Change-Id: I6a5a2da6541596b7d1b7c1bf2795cfc6f86191fb
Partial-Bug: #1606520
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/37/348437/25 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy from ironic.conductor import notify_utils as notifyfrom ironic.objects import fields # states and event for notification self._prev_provision_state = None self._prev_target_provision_state = None self._event = None self._node = None def _notify_provision_state_change(self, immediate=True): """Emit notification about change node provision state.""" node = self.node or self._node state = node.provision_state prev_state = self._prev_provision_state if state == prev_state: return if state in notify.ERROR_STATES: phase = 'fail' priority = fields.NotificationPriority.ERROR elif immediate: phase = 'end' if (state in notify.UNSTABLE_STATES and prev_state in notify.UNSTABLE_STATES): priority = fields.NotificationPriority.DEBUG else: priority = fields.NotificationPriority.INFO else: phase = 'start' priority = fields.NotificationPriority.INFO notify.emit_set_provision_notification( self.context, node, self._prev_provision_state, self._prev_target_provision_state, self._event, priority, phase) # save previous states and event self._prev_provision_state = self.node.provision_state self._prev_target_provision_state = self.node.target_provision_state self._event = event if callback is None: self._notify_provision_state_change() else: # save if resources will be released before notification at exit self._node = copy.deepcopy(self.node) self._notify_provision_state_change(immediate=False)

commit_message:
Give better output on scale failures

Currently when there's a failure during scale the output is
pprinted json that is confusing and uninstrutive

Printing the return message message attribute gives all the important
status needed from that json

Change-Id: I6e81f5812895f50209d1dc7a35c4f8fbd2447926
Partial-Bug: #1640933

commit_message:
doc: Update architecture about deprecation

Change-Id: Ie67d43f2e63287245cef2ba248799a729498fb67
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/73/406073/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 3. (optional/deprecated) collector - daemon designed to gather and record event and metering data4. (optional/deprecated) api - service to query and view data recorded by collectorbut by default it will listen to ``notifications.info`` and ``notification.sample``. The listeners grab messages off the defined topics and redistributes them to the appropriate plugins(endpoints) to be processed into Events and Samples.Publishing/Storing the data ---------------------------1. gnocchi, which publishes samples/events to Gnocchi API which can be consumed by an external system (or the deprecated collector); that supports Kafka; 6. file, which writes the samples/events to file; 7. database, which stores samples/events to the legacy ceilometer database system. Deprecated Componments ======================Since mitaka, the collector doesn't received any data from polling agents, but only from notification agent. It's not recommended to use it anymore. It does nothing excepting adding lag. Instead, the notification agent pipeline should be configured to publisher the event/sample to http/gnocchi/database/... the notification agent. It validates the incoming data and (if the signature is valid) then writes the messages to a declared target: database, file, gnocchi or http.]].. _send their own application centric data: ./webapi/v2.html#user-defined-data
deleted_lines: 3. (optional) collector - daemon designed to gather and record event and metering data4. (optional) api - service to query and view data recorded by collectorbut by default it will listen to ``notifications.info``. The listeners grab messages off the defined topics and redistributes them to the appropriate plugins(endpoints) to be processed into Events and Samples.Publishing the data -------------------1. direct, which publishes samples to a configured dispatcher directly, default is database dispatcher; which can be consumed by the collector or an external system; that supports Kafka. Storing the data ================the notification and polling agents. It validates the incoming data and (if the signature is valid) then writes the messages to a declared target: database, file, gnocchi or http. Accessing the data ================== .. _send their own application centric data: ./webapi/v2.html#user-defined-data

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/f7ce42bd630cfb1806b7788189a4437d\n'

Change-Id: I3828469844ba2df4ec6401a2df6cb6149006527c

commit_message:
Fix transport url with empty port

When transport url is set to something like "amqp://hostname:/"
it currently raise ValueError while any url parsing library
(like urlparse) just ignore the port, and don't fail since this is a
value url.

This change make the transport url ignore empty port instead of raising
ValueError.

Change-Id: I04df76012e3b133eddbcf365363cd261d277e369

commit_message:
[7.0] remove fuel-library6.1

Since both fuel-library6.1 and fuel-library7.0 provide "fuel-library"
there is a non-zero chance that fuel-library6.1 can be used somewhere
inside containers, since it is installed on an ISO. This commit ensures
that fuel-library6.1 won't be copied on the ISO avoiding possible
issues.

Closes-Bug: #1646061
Change-Id: Iac565a0f3e46223282fa7931fb1a0dc4f54aeec9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/19/403719/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Check if an index on given columns exists

We have many cases to check if an index exists on a given columns. Like:

"https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/db/sqlalchemy/
migrate_repo/versions/347_add_updated_at_index.py#L30-L37"

In addition, It's very frequent to get all indexes from a table, so we
need a reusable function to avoid duplicate effort.

Change-Id: Iadd9b6ac7586e9b50357ca799eb605f4772e0ece
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/28/402128/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_indexes(self): self.assertFalse(utils.index_exists(self.engine, 'test_table', 'index_a')) self.assertFalse(utils.index_exists(self.engine, 'test_table', 'index_b')) Index('index_a', self.test_table.c.a).create(self.engine) Index('index_b', self.test_table.c.b).create(self.engine) indexes = utils.get_indexes(self.engine, "test_table") indexes = [(index['name'], index['column_names']) for index in indexes] self.assertTrue(('index_a', ['a']) in indexes) self.assertTrue(('index_b', ['b']) in indexes) def test_index_exists_on_columns(self): self.assertFalse(utils.index_exists(self.engine, 'test_table', 'new_index')) columns = [self.test_table.c.a, self.test_table.c.b] Index('new_index', *columns).create(self.engine) self.assertTrue(utils.index_exists_on_columns(self.engine, 'test_table', ('a', 'b'))) if __name__ == "__main__": import unittest unittest.main()

subject: ceilometerdb-size.yaml: Fix ceilometer database validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 11:36:03.000000000', 'files': ['validations/ceilometerdb-size.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations/commit/63021890727c74147e5f1da2309d124eacac8724', 'message': 'ceilometerdb-size.yaml: Fix ceilometer database validation

- now fails even if values are not set (they are -1 by default)
- since the limit is infinite for all negative values, validation
  does not only check -1, but passes only for custom values >= 0

Change-Id: I927e1b1296f3d89ac087916d8e4adc184185bcc5
Closes-Bug: #1643813
'}]
commit_message:
ceilometerdb-size.yaml: Fix ceilometer database validation

- now fails even if values are not set (they are -1 by default)
- since the limit is infinite for all negative values, validation
  does not only check -1, but passes only for custom values >= 0

Change-Id: I927e1b1296f3d89ac087916d8e4adc184185bcc5
Closes-Bug: #1643813
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/76/406076/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The undercloud's ceilometer database can grow to a substantial size if metering_time_to_live and event_time_to_live is set to a negative value (infinite limit). This validation checks each setting and fails if variables are set to a negative value or if they have no custom setting (their value is -1 by default). - name: Get TTL setting values from ceilometer.conf - name: Check values fail: msg="Value of {{ item.item }} is set to {{ item.value or "-1" }}." when: item.value|int < 0 or item.value == None with_items: "{{ config_result.results }}"
deleted_lines: The undercloud's ceilometer database can grow to a substantial size if metering_time_to_live and event_time_to_live is set to -1 (infinite). We check each setting and fail if -1 is set. ttl_value: "-1" - name: Check ceilomter.conf for a -1 TTL setting failed_when: "ttl_value == config_result.value"

commit_message:
Add Zaqar to scenario002

Install Zaqar into the overcloud and create a queue with
OS::Zaqar::Queue in order to test the Zaqar composable service.

Change-Id: I9027d17fa3d75e6c3e23d6636642abadac8730ac
Depends-On: Ia5ca4fe317339dd05b0fa3d5abebca6ca5066bce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/37/404737/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: zaqar_queue: type: OS::Zaqar::Queue properties: name: pingtest-queue

commit_message:
Composable Zaqar services

Adds new puppet and puppet pacemaker specific services for Zaqar.

The Pacemaker templates extend the default Zaqar services and swap in
the Pacemaker specific puppet-tripleo profile instead.

Change-Id: Ia5ca4fe317339dd05b0fa3d5abebca6ca5066bce
Depends-On: Ie215289a7be681a2b1aa5495d3f965c005d62f52
Depends-On: I0b077e85ba5fcd9fdfd33956cf33ce2403fcb088
Implements: blueprint composable-services-within-roles

define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as

commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: Ifc67efe9c60b0dc751255a238ae31b8bb56bd9e6

commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I4bd903a6a24c62e98781ea0984585bbc50551568

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/98b00464162ee86432c795072c212da2

Change-Id: I0c8499df419d68991af3efe833847c2a28e82e28

commit_message:
Remove all keystone scenarios from keystone-v2api-rally job

Devstack has problem with v2 keystone. let's turn off all keyston
scenarios from failed job. Merge all v2+v3 compatibility things and
turn them on again.

Change-Id: I23bdf363b37f27d74d411927c4a15336a3449a3b

commit_message:
Revert "Move default Keystone API version to v3"

It breaks at least rally and magnum jobs and makes redundat one of
novaclient's job. Such changes should not be made in silence.

This reverts commit 75bf9722392c9fc1ca7c6a95b99e8897c86d4271.

Change-Id: Ife5ca266fd2d81f457bd8ac6ea75ed47f9c3dd22

commit_message:
collect-logs: add rdoproject env requirements

Zuul uses different variables and files to handle artifact uploading,
this change adds the required modifications to collect and publish logs
in the rdoproject.org Zuul environment.

Change-Id: I5d74392210e55be5f5ecd889a5017750a874d45a

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used
to keep codes from oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator.
Removing openstack/commonfrom all OpenStack code in favor of the
Oslo libraries is a project wide goal for the Ocata release. So
don't use this directory any more. We should drop it for improving
searching efficiency.

Change-Id: Id8553d95bef7d2aa9f1f58b549a601bac1a30adf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-ui refs/changes/72/402272/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Yaql Tasks Function

This new function will allow user to get a list of tasks matching certain
filter. For example only task in state ERROR from the current execution.

It is very useful for debugging, but also very expensive, since it might
require multiple DB queries. In addition it is important to remember a lot
of data can return from this function, so it should be used carefully

Change-Id: I452175bfb60636ed8de9b2b1ceab615359765964
Implements: blueprint yaql-tasks-function
Implements: blueprint yaql-errors-function

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

commit_message:
Fix pci_alias that include white spaces

When the PCI alias was getting translated to a PCI request,
all the white spaces were getting removed. So the pci_passthrough:alias
specified in the flavor never matched the device in pci_alias.
This patch fixes the bug by only stripping the white spaces
at the beginning or the end of the elements

Change-Id: I2888b03faf6c25bcb6011db40100d925972c2231
Closes-Bug: #1638200

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should only use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: Id217f5054c6e586ff89291fa4ceb05ff06a1bafc
Closes-Bug: #1082248

commit_message:
Further improvement to deterministic suffix re-hashing tests

Actually verify that replication_cycle cycles between 0 and 9,
wrapping back to 0.

Verify that unique results from _do_listdir are passed to _get_hashes

Drive by fix some typos.

Change-Id: I9132c28994aeaef59293c1948cc1d8cbccaaf84d
Related-Change: I7a812603e082025b16bb3dc07b263d7a0bde1c26

commit_message:
Remove redundant code from functions.guest.sh

Due to a rebasing error, the Newton update added to functions.guest.sh
copies of functions that had already been added to the file with an
earlier patch.

This changeset removes the redundant function definitions.

Change-Id: I88d2d40f03035e9a50a18ac40838cc7eee535b48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/70/399970/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Return the nth network interface name (not counting loopback; 0 -> eth0) function ifnum_to_ifname { local if_num=$1 # Skip loopback and start counting with next interface local iface=${IF_NAMES[$((if_num + 1))]} echo >&2 "ifnum_to_ifname: interface $if_num is $iface" echo "$iface" } # Get all network interfaces (e.g. eth0, p2p1, ens0, enp0s3) into an array function set_iface_list { unset IF_NAMES local iface for iface in $(ip -o link show|awk '/: / {print $2}'|tr -d ':'); do IF_NAMES+=($iface) done echo "Set IF_NAMES to ${IF_NAMES[*]}" }

of the volume connector table, since it does not seem useful to have
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285218/42/ironic/tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py).

added_lines: ============================================== Bare Metal Introspection Service Upgrade Guide ============================================== The `release notes <http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ironic-inspector/>`_ should always be read carefully when upgrading the ironic-inspector service. Starting with the Mitaka series, specific upgrade steps and considerations are well-documented in the release notes. Upgrades are only supported one series at a time, or within a series. General upgrades - all versions =============================== The ironic services should always be upgraded before ironic-inspector, as newer ironic-inspector may be using API features available only in newer ironic. When upgrading ironic-inspector, the following steps should always be taken: * Update ironic-inspector code, without restarting the service yet. * Run database migrations. * Restart the ironic-inspector service. * Upgrade the ironic-python-agent image used for introspection.

commit_message:
Validate the plan name before running

By default the plan name is used on the creation of the node name
in the form of plan_name + role + index

Forcing the plan name to be only letters and numbers removes the
possibility of a failed deploy due to an invalid node name

Change-Id: I3d6193a3b547dd1ce782b258a3e99716b4047a4e
Closes-Bug: #1644587

The os-xenapi project is a common project for accessing XenAPI based
hypervisors from any OpenStack project.

For new Requirements Q&A:
[Q] Is the library actively maintained?
[A] Yes. This is a new library maintained by the XenAPI team for common
    code.  Much of the initial code is transferred from Nova so it can
    be used by multiple OpenStack projects.

[Q] Is the library good code?
[A] Yes. OpenStack Style Guidelines is supported, and the CI system is
    already running pep8 checking.

[Q] Is the library python 3 compatible?
[A] Yes, and Python3 Unit Tests are already running.

[Q] Is the library license compatible?
[A] Yes, the Apache License 2.0

[Q] Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu

[A] No, this is a new library.

    in global-requirements.txt?

    other OpenStack projects.

[Q] Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
    infrastructure setup?
[A] Yes, Nova initially will use it, with a plan for other projects to
    also use this shared library.

    WIP change for Nova: I401188a3a6d231fc7d03c8d518946f738f9d8d1b

Change-Id: If61a96b5844f357e35b205a4083718165ee219c9
'}]
commit_message:
Add os-xenapi to global requirements.

The os-xenapi project is a common project for accessing XenAPI based
hypervisors from any OpenStack project.

For new Requirements Q&A:
[Q] Is the library actively maintained?
[A] Yes. This is a new library maintained by the XenAPI team for common
    code.  Much of the initial code is transferred from Nova so it can
    be used by multiple OpenStack projects.

[Q] Is the library good code?
[A] Yes. OpenStack Style Guidelines is supported, and the CI system is
    already running pep8 checking.

[Q] Is the library python 3 compatible?
[A] Yes, and Python3 Unit Tests are already running.

[Q] Is the library license compatible?
[A] Yes, the Apache License 2.0

[Q] Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
    latest / Fedora latest)?
[A] No, this is a new library.

[Q] Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
    in global-requirements.txt?
[A] No; much of the code is being moved from Nova so it can be used in
    other OpenStack projects.

[Q] Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
    infrastructure setup?
[A] Yes, Nova initially will use it, with a plan for other projects to
    also use this shared library.
    BP for Nova: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-os-xenapi-library
    WIP change for Nova: I401188a3a6d231fc7d03c8d518946f738f9d8d1b

Change-Id: If61a96b5844f357e35b205a4083718165ee219c9

commit_message:
Add a note for NIC drivers

Sriov enabling may or may not work depending on device
drivers used, adding a note for alert to make sure drivers
are updated while using sriov-capability.

Change-Id: Idbe3df3c77a419ed86fcf7a3a3b614aecad70c67
Closes-Bug: #1614564
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/49/404949/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ..note:: Specific NIC drivers may be needed while using NIC from a particular vendor. For example Intel's NIC works with driver ixgbe of 4.4.6 version and driver ixgbevf of 3.2.2 version.

commit_message:
Copy map-services script to tripleo elements

map-services will be removed on dib v2 branch, but
tripleo still relies heavily on it. To prevent breakage,
copy the script to the internal element using it.
In the future, all elements will need to be migrated
to new svc-map, but it is a massive change.

Change-Id: Idd762c45ed9dc8d14b6f06fa29b89657101e828a
Depends-On: I71082a0ad06a5ddc7c4d48e12f5258686a434069

commit_message:
Update of min renderspec version to v1.2.0

 * set requirement >= instead of == to set minimum required version
   and to do not update this file in case of new released version of rendespec

Change-Id: Ia385276613d54485c11f7de1388a1c532f0da616

commit_message:
Serialization for NIC and Bond attributes

Add plugin's NIC and Bond attributes in serialized data
for orchestrator.

Change-Id: I9b6543cfc443929cd9d64d8578e2fec3be43bf19
Implements: blueprint nics-and-nodes-attributes-via-plugin

commit_message:
Fix unbound variable in standalone ping test

When running the ping test standalone MULTINODE_ENV_NAME won't be
set.  To avoid the script dying on an unbound variable error we
need to default it.

Change-Id: I23d18005a4eb4e49ebfc35f66a3543e5e2684e8a

subject: Add overall stats to ci-status page
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-14 22:19:36.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo-jobs-gerrit.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/02c3d61b35c666b9cb25b2beef5bb2431d61c87d', 'message': "Add overall stats to ci-status page

Roll up the results into three categories: passed, partial failures,
and complete failures.  Passed means all reported jobs passed,
partial failure means some jobs passed and some failed, complete
failure means all jobs failed.  Note that these results will be
somewhat transient for patches with jobs still in progress.

I think having these numbers easily available will be helpful in
telling us the health of CI.  Passed jobs are obviously good,
complete failure jobs are usually legitimate failures (unless there's
a complete CI outage), and partial jobs are usually where you would
look to find intermittent problems (i.e. the hard ones).  Keeping
the partial number low should mean TripleO is pretty healthy from a
test perspective.

Change-Id: I5a1dd0f31c26f9d0b41fef9268000fb2f3dc54d2
"}]
commit_message:
Add overall stats to ci-status page

Roll up the results into three categories: passed, partial failures,
and complete failures.  Passed means all reported jobs passed,
partial failure means some jobs passed and some failed, complete
failure means all jobs failed.  Note that these results will be
somewhat transient for patches with jobs still in progress.

I think having these numbers easily available will be helpful in
telling us the health of CI.  Passed jobs are obviously good,
complete failure jobs are usually legitimate failures (unless there's
a complete CI outage), and partial jobs are usually where you would
look to find intermittent problems (i.e. the hard ones).  Keeping
the partial number low should mean TripleO is pretty healthy from a
test perspective.

Change-Id: I5a1dd0f31c26f9d0b41fef9268000fb2f3dc54d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/97/397397/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:

Overall

" % ( passed_jobs, total, float(passed_jobs) / float(total) * 100 )) fp.write("Partial Failures: %d/%d (%d %%)
" % ( partial_jobs, total, float(partial_jobs) / float(total) * 100 )) fp.write("Complete Failures: %d/%d (%d %%)
" % ( failed_jobs, total, float(failed_jobs) / float(total) * 100 ))

subject: Add line break between review link and duration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-14 22:19:36.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo-jobs-gerrit.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/6faaeb15bb9e05c320ba7d1b8ed1b17422ad87d9', 'message': "Add line break between review link and duration

Because of the number of jobs we're reporting on the ci-status page
now, I see some weird line breaks in the middle of the duration.
This makes it difficult to visually scan job durations.  For example,
one job on the page currently looks like this:

397267,1 - 1h
52m log

Since there are already three lines in the first column of the
table, let's just make each job report two lines explicitly so they
don't get broken up in weird ways.  This change would result in the
following format for the job above:

397267,1
1h 52m log

Change-Id: Ia067ed16276a1b7ec4e08e636968467d5eacf752
"}]
commit_message:
Add line break between review link and duration

Because of the number of jobs we're reporting on the ci-status page
now, I see some weird line breaks in the middle of the duration.
This makes it difficult to visually scan job durations.  For example,
one job on the page currently looks like this:

397267,1 - 1h
52m log

Since there are already three lines in the first column of the
table, let's just make each job report two lines explicitly so they
don't get broken up in weird ways.  This change would result in the
following format for the job above:

397267,1
1h 52m log

Change-Id: Ia067ed16276a1b7ec4e08e636968467d5eacf752
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/96/397396/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update container images to point to newton

centos-binary-data is not necessary anymore since data containers have
been replaced by named volumes.

Change-Id: I94a5463f92959e11d07684352252280555d548c5
Depends-On: I82fa58e19de94ec78ca242154bc6ecc592112d1b
Closes-Bug: #1646540
(cherry picked from commit 991e52931f7438d6cc8752390b5f109ac8d458a0)

commit_message:
Update tox.ini for py27 requirement

Reactive source charms are Python3-only, but have py27 unit tests
declared in project-config.

The Tox tool recently changed behavior.  It used to pass when a tox
target was missing commands.  Now it fails in that case.

This commit places a py27 no-op shim to allow gate tests to pass,
effectively restoring the original behavior for these py3x-only repos.

Fix unit tests after underlying changes in charms.openstack which
set_config_defined_certs_and_keys and added oncigure_source to
the default install method.

Change-Id: I82445240c49a2d58c6eb39da4f49d21350d8d8b4
Partial-Bug: 1642981
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-aodh refs/changes/47/403947/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:py27] basepython = python2.7 # Reactive source charms are Python3-only, but a py27 unit test target # is required by OpenStack Governance. Remove this shim as soon as # permitted. http://governance.openstack.org/reference/cti/python_cti.html whitelist_externals = true commands = true basepython = python3.5

commit_message:
Update tox.ini for py27 requirement

Reactive source charms are Python3-only, but have py27 unit tests
declared in project-config.

The Tox tool recently changed behavior.  It used to pass when a tox
target was missing commands.  Now it fails in that case.

This commit places a py27 no-op shim to allow gate tests to pass,
effectively restoring the original behavior for these py3x-only repos.

Change-Id: I3b53e36874805f453b29de28b76184aaf2da5c97
Partial-Bug: 1642981
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-openvswitch-odl refs/changes/53/403953/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:py27] basepython = python2.7 # Reactive source charms are Python3-only, but a py27 unit test target # is required by OpenStack Governance. Remove this shim as soon as # permitted. http://governance.openstack.org/reference/cti/python_cti.html whitelist_externals = true commands = true basepython = python3.5

commit_message:
Add ability to override MTU for networks

* This patch make ability for override ML2/path_mtu into:
      quantum_settings:
        . . .
        L2:
          segmentation_type: tun
          path_mtu: 8000
          tunnel_id_ranges: 2:65535

Change-Id: Ibb4c984751cd234db4a481819e390a79c27545d0
Closes-bug: #1589944

commit_message:
Make Murano always use the latest CoreLibrary

When we updating environment Murano doesn't update
CoreLibrary if it's already installed. So we need
to make it always install latest CoreLibrary version.

Change-Id: I702d6e393fd24dc8649f02b72d83c14aeed3bff9
Closes-Bug: #1624723
(cherry picked from commit 329c4bb32750bcba480df778a5051147cf34bf29)

commit_message:
Set dns extension driver

Dns-integration extension was disabled by default in neutron,
we must set it explisitly

Change-Id: I7a9aae67a6f567f9a6049bcdf96195775de8a16b
Closes-Bug: #1628540

commit_message:
Update ref for puppetlabs-mysql

Upstream patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/387880/ adds
new options for mysql user creation, these options require
puppetlabs-mysql 3.10.0, and mysql 3.10.0 requires the latest
galera

Change-Id: I72b09df6b4e4c2448cdfbc0b028f72d317eb706a
Closes-Bug: #1644222

commit_message:
Grant Compute user write permission  to Glance images pool

Nova has implemented instance rbd snapshot feature to reduce snapshot
time, to use this feature, Nova requires write permission to Glance
images pool.

Closes-Bug: #1641815

Change-Id: I0d57d3fb352c68309432084c68d1d24e4f6ce8b6

commit_message:
Enable show_multiple_loations option for glance when using Ceph

When using Ceph as storage backend, to take the benefit of Ceph
inside snapshot, show_multiple_locations option needs to be enabled
so image snapshot can be done using ceph clone.

Change-Id: I8ecfcbd7b0df518f5dcf046693203bd7815efbb2
Closes-Bug: #1641572

commit_message:
devstack: fix k8s setup-files for hyperkube >=1.4

With Kubernetes 1.4.0 the hyperkube scripts that setup the certificates
for API <-> nodes communication changed the place where they place the
certificates. This patch accomodates these differences.

Change-Id: I5f5755977be91325dac369d1f716893c2b071acf
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Fix default domain id in openrc

Current keystone in Mitaka has case sensitive check for domain ids,
so we need to change OS_DEFAULT_DOMAIN from 'Default' to 'default'
in openrc

Change-Id: Ieb50bf82639282cbe2f92efbe66a439af135bcca
Closes-Bug: #1645737
(cherry picked from commit 2bc8f54079645b77cb5e7a4b24ffc7773e41ce56)

commit_message:
Skip qemu-kvm from Nagios-monitored services

The qemu-kvm service should not be configured as monitored in Nagios
when the NRPE relation is set, since it's a one-shot service.

Closes-Bug: #1645822
Change-Id: I20b4eeb7971bae69f29183814e8c61a977e80bf0
(cherry picked from commit 8178cd4bdb35ffacd27620e3d8b81708de264786)

commit_message:
Incorporate driver-validation into node-detail panels

Driver validation information has been added to the node-details/
configuration page. The driver validation information is located
in close proximity to the driver properties section, and will
update as property values are changed.

To accomodate the driver validation information the following
changes have been made to the layout and organization of the
node-details/configuration page:
(1) The list of Extra properties has been removed from the General
section and is now treated as a separate collection in a similar
manner to Properties and Instance_info.
(2) The new grid layout is:
  Row 1 (top) General, Ports
  Row 2 Driver Info, Driver Validation
  Row 3 Properties, Instance Info
  Row 4 Extra
(3) The list of instance_info items displayed for the pxe_ssh
driver has been enhanced.

Change-Id: I0ba8ac0fc1e4a1b0f2f4b03b738f56ed380a11c7

commit_message:
Remove ordering assumption from functional test

oslo.messaging doesn't ensure ordering of notification. By chance
that works for some driver/setup. But for example zmq job often
fail this one.

This changes removes this assumption.

That fixes the zmq gate job

Change-Id: I2087f0a219a4a5b8fb30bb8ed84e1a72f8d9e0ab

added_lines: def check_received(listener, publisher, messages): actuals = sorted([listener.events.get(timeout=0.5) for __ in range(len(a_out))]) expected = sorted([('info', m[0], m[1], publisher) for m in messages]) self.assertEqual(expected, actuals) check_received(listener_a, "pub-1", a_out) check_received(listener_b, "pub-2", a_out)
deleted_lines: for expected in a_out: actual = listener_a.events.get(timeout=0.5) self.assertEqual('info', actual[0]) self.assertEqual(expected[0], actual[1]) self.assertEqual(expected[1], actual[2]) self.assertEqual('pub-1', actual[3]) for expected in b_out: actual = listener_b.events.get(timeout=0.5) self.assertEqual('info', actual[0]) self.assertEqual(expected[0], actual[1]) self.assertEqual(expected[1], actual[2]) self.assertEqual('pub-2', actual[3])

commit_message:
priorities: Populate Ocata priorities

Based on the mail sent out by mriedem:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107476.html

Change-Id: I446bb7cb68fd0b07265e21528fb9cbfd7888eb02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/26/400326/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: List of themes (in the form of use cases) the nova development team is prioritizing in Ocata (in no particular order). .. list-table:: - * Priority * Primary Contacts - * `Resource Providers`_ * `Sylvain Bauza`_, `Chris Dent`_, `Jay Pipes`_ - * `Cells v2`_ * `Dan Smith`_, `Melanie Witt`_, `Matt Riedemann`_ - * `API Improvements`_ * `Kevin Zheng`, `Alex Xu`_ - * `Neutron Interaction`_ * `John Garbutt`_ .. _Sylvain Bauza: https://launchpad.net/~sylvain-bauza .. _Chris Dent: https://launchpad.net/~cdent .. _Jay Pipes: https://launchpad.net/~jaypipes .. _Dan Smith: https://launchpad.net/~danms .. _Melanie Witt: https://launchpad.net/~melwitt .. _Matt Riedemann: https://launchpad.net/~mriedem .. _Alex Xu: https://launchpad.net/~xuhj .. _John Garbutt: https://launchpad.net/~johngarbutt Resource Providers ------------------ There are three efforts here which can be worked concurrently, but the priority order is: 1. Making nova-scheduler use the placement service. Sylvain Bauza is working on this. 2. Handling shared storage/IP pools. Chris Dent is working on the server side aggregates changes for this and Jay Pipes is working on the client side pieces in the resource tracker. 3. Custom resource classes. Jay Pipes is leading the development on this and already has most, if not all, of the code up for review, some if it already merged. Cells v2 -------- 1. Scheduler interaction. Dan Smith is leading the development work on this, lots of code is up for review and some of the series is already merged. 2. Adding the multi-cell simple python merge sort / filtering for listing instances. Dan Smith signed up to work on this. 3. Quotas. Melanie Witt is owning this, and as pointed out in an earlier recap on this specific session we might change how we do quotas for cells v2 in the API. 4. CI testing. Matt Riedemann is signed up to work on this. Some of the work has already gone into switching Ocata CI jobs (except cellsv1) to Neutron by default, making nova-network fail to start unless you're in a cells v1 environment (dansmith wrote that patch), and then enabling cells v2 in master branch jobs by default (there are grenade changes needed for this). Eventually Matt will be working on multinode (multicell) support here too. API Improvements ---------------- In Ocata, we will focus on two major API improvement efforts: * JSON schema validation of parameters. This is a dependency for cells v2. * Restricting server list sort/filter Neutron Interaction ------------------- In Ocata, we will focus on moving neutron port creation to the conductor. This is a dependency for supporting routed networks which is a dependency for using neutron with multiple cells, i.e. cells v2. John Garbutt already started working on this in Newton so this is just a continuation of that work in Ocata.
deleted_lines: TODO: fill this in after summit

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/530e0e5b4b1d18aa8296e0daaeb95158

Change-Id: I86716b7c68ff5012034f5a14d2c4907013b93556
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/performance-docs refs/changes/27/403027/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================== Team and repository tags ======================== .. image:: http://governance.openstack.org/badges/performance-docs.svg :target: http://governance.openstack.org/reference/tags/index.html .. Change things from this point on

commit_message:
Use network-based fqdn entry from hiera instead of the custom fact

This changes how we get the network-based FQDNs for the specific
services, from using the custom fact, to the new hiera entries.

Change-Id: Iae668a5d89fb7bee091db4a761aa6c91d369b276

subject: [badge] Add title elements to svg
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 22:04:35.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/_exts/badges.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/14e928bbf8d3de38b766160cdb9d1b4577b4c2b6', 'message': "[badge] Add title elements to svg

Add title elements describing the svg for accessibility purposes.
This is of limited use because the svg will be brought into an html
document via the img element, but it could be useful if a visually
impaired user accesses the svg directly.  The title on each badge
is just a statement of the badge name.  While sparse, it's helpful
because while the text elements of each badge contain this info,
it's duplicated and split up and would not be easy to understand.

Change-Id: Ia0a9b09221cf6bce029d1a5cee523efef201cf54
"}]
commit_message:
[badge] Add title elements to svg

Add title elements describing the svg for accessibility purposes.
This is of limited use because the svg will be brought into an html
document via the img element, but it could be useful if a visually
impaired user accesses the svg directly.  The title on each badge
is just a statement of the badge name.  While sparse, it's helpful
because while the text elements of each badge contain this info,
it's duplicated and split up and would not be easy to understand.

Change-Id: Ia0a9b09221cf6bce029d1a5cee523efef201cf54

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/d281d3e7bd4da998ab834a085c1ba7b3\n'

Change-Id: I32e2e2a045130f9d229c8de459dc7d52d5eac928

commit_message:
Remove some projects from ironic governance

ironic-webclient no longer has contributors working on it, and will be
retired. It was never even close to production-ready.

python-dracclient is intended to only interact with a single vendor's
hardware, which the ironic team decided[0] we no longer wish to maintain
in ironic's governance. It will continue to be maintained outside of the
ironic governance.

python-wsmanclient is only used by our AMT driver, which is being
dropped from ironic governance soon.[1] Furthermore, it is code to speak
a particular flavor of XML, as I understand things, and so isn't really
part of ironic's mission. This will continue to be maintained outside of
ironic governance.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/392685/
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/106862.html

Change-Id: I4fb9bfb69a75ed5aa0277959c88e6f2f753deebb

commit_message:
Improved entrypoint macro for tempest plugin

* Fixed typo in the entrypoint macro

* Improved entrypoint macro for openstack services
  having different servicename and modulename
  For example: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/3804/

Change-Id: Id546117ea96251d2f85bf23dfd0d8b2e6d38a309
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/16/405416/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The prefix is %py2_entrypoint %{modulename} %{service} # where service is the name of the openstack-service or the modulename# Example: %py2_entrypoint %{modulename} %{service} # In most of the cases %{service} is same as %{modulename} # but in case of neutron plugins it is different # like servicename is neutron-lbaas and modulename is neutron_lbass %py2_entrypoint() \ egg_path=%{buildroot}%{python2_sitelib}/%{1}-*.egg-info \ tempest_egg_path=%{buildroot}%{python2_sitelib}/%{1}_tests.egg-info \sed -i "s/%{2}/%{1}_tests/g" $tempest_egg_path/PKG-INFO \
deleted_lines: # The prefix is %py2_entrypoint %{service} # where service is the name of the openstack-service or modulename# Example: %py2_entrypoint %{service} py2_entrypoint() \ egg_path=%{buildroot}/%{python2_sitelib}/%{1}-*.egg-info \ tempest_egg_path=%{buildroot}/%{python2_sitelib}/%{1}_tests.egg-info \sed -i "s/%{1}/%{1}_tests/g" $tempest_egg_path/PKG-INFO \

commit_message:
networking-bagpipe: run tempest job only if >newton

The rationale behind running tempest jobs only if >newton
is that the burden, in particular on neutron-stable-maint,
of backporting the different changes required in our devstack
plugin and CI scripts, does not seem well proportioned given
that stable/(liberty|mitaka|newton) have never had tempest
coverage to start with.

Change-Id: I0f992a6eb35dc6072e943fec0450c13febdf8522

commit_message:
Fix swift-get-nodes arg parsing for missing ring

- Verify .ring.gz path exist if ring file is the first argument.
- Code Refactoring:
  - swift/cli/info.parse_get_node_args()
  - Respective test cases for info.parse_get_node_args()

Closes-Bug: #1539275

Change-Id: Ib7b31c1b8436238c3d488b435e9bfa2dec834888
Signed-off-by: Sachin Patil <psachin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/99/349199/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from argparse import Namespacefrom swift.cli.info import (print_db_info_metadata, print_ring_locations, print_info, print_obj_metadata, print_obj, InfoSystemExit, print_item_locations, parse_get_node_args) def test_parse_get_node_args(self): # Capture error messages # (without any parameters) options = Namespace(policy_name=None, partition=None) args = '' self.assertRaisesMessage(InfoSystemExit, 'Need to specify policy_name or <ring.gz>', parse_get_node_args, options, args.split()) # -P test options = Namespace(policy_name='test', partition=None) args = '' self.assertRaisesMessage(InfoSystemExit, 'policy_name requires partition', parse_get_node_args, options, args.split()) # -P test a c o options = Namespace(policy_name='test') args = 'a c o' self.assertRaisesMessage(InfoSystemExit, 'Ring file does not exist', parse_get_node_args, options, args.split()) # a c o options = Namespace(policy_name=None) args = 'a c o' self.assertRaisesMessage(InfoSystemExit, 'Ring file does not exist', parse_get_node_args, options, args.split()) # objects.ring.gz a c o blah blah options = Namespace(policy_name=None) args = 'objects.ring.gz a c o blah blah' self.assertRaisesMessage(InfoSystemExit, 'Invalid arguments', parse_get_node_args, options, args.split()) # objects.ring.gz a/c/o/blah/blah options = Namespace(policy_name=None) args = 'objects.ring.gz a/c/o/blah/blah' self.assertRaisesMessage(InfoSystemExit, 'Invalid arguments', parse_get_node_args, options, args.split()) # Test options and args # objects.ring.gz a/c/o options = Namespace(policy_name=None) args = 'object.ring.gz a/c/o' with mock.patch('swift.cli.info.os.path.exists', lambda p: True): ring_path, args = parse_get_node_args(options, args.split()) self.assertEqual(ring_path, 'object.ring.gz') self.assertEqual(args, ['a', 'c', 'o']) # objects.ring.gz a c o options = Namespace(policy_name=None) args = 'object.ring.gz a c o' with mock.patch('swift.cli.info.os.path.exists', lambda p: True): ring_path, args = parse_get_node_args(options, args.split()) self.assertEqual(ring_path, 'object.ring.gz') self.assertEqual(args, ['a', 'c', 'o']) # --all objects.ring.gz a c o options = Namespace(all=True, policy_name=None) args = 'object.ring.gz a c o' with mock.patch('swift.cli.info.os.path.exists', lambda p: True): ring_path, args = parse_get_node_args(options, args.split()) self.assertEqual(ring_path, 'object.ring.gz') self.assertEqual(args, ['a', 'c', 'o']) # -P test -p 1 options = Namespace(policy_name='test', partition='1') args = '' ring_path, args = parse_get_node_args(options, args.split()) self.assertEqual(ring_path, None) self.assertEqual(args, []) # commit_message:
Add additional parser for json command output

Some commands returns different format output.
Like [{"Field": "name", "Value": "val"}, {...}]. So the
simple parser was added to change output to
{"name": "val", "name2": "val2"}

Change-Id: I38c65beafae92b5ef18de72f003aacb31e02ea98
Closes-Bug: 1637504

commit_message:
Cleanup tests from deterministic suffix updates

Move _do_listdir out as a pure function.  Update relevent test
infrastructure and increase coverage.  Follow-up from related change.

Related-Change: Ib5c9dd17e40150450ec57a728ae8652fbc730af6

Change-Id: I7a812603e082025b16bb3dc07b263d7a0bde1c26

commit_message:
Update legcy code depending on Nova V2 API plugin

Blazar-nova uses Nova API plugin frameworks.
V2 of the framework is now frozen [1], however, some lines of V2
dependent code were still included.

This patch removes the V2 dependent code.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_plugins.html

Change-Id: Ie5e2db61de97c330d5ae343a9c59d45e444e119f
Closes-Bug: #1644680

commit_message:
[User Guides] Admin Guide Compute Flavour Conversion

The average inboud traffic speed of 256 Mbps is incorrect -
assuming a unit of K = 1000, the speed would be 268 Mbps.

Change-Id: I4fa7811276f29069845256d0ff670fd3dc93e266
Closes-bug: #1617450

commit_message:
Use the absolute path for temp templates

If the template is not in the user's t-h-t root, we should use the
absolute path instead of the one in the template since we've already
copied these files in the temp dir.

Change-Id: I9a575575fc3c0fc78848239fc7b663ca4508fcfa

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I8af9278ffefcc20cf7447ecff7470217cd0e4632

commit_message:
Apply constant table name to db_store and db_consistent

Constant table name was introduced in [1]. This patch will apply
the constant table name to db_store and newly added db_consistent.
So that all df codes uses constant as nb db table name.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/401209/

Change-Id: I4c7b3f25c177c938a66c065d6f30f45106c8cdc4

commit_message:
l3: Remove _confirm_router_interface_not_in_use override

The base class in Neutron has been changed to be an equivalent
of our version. [1]

[1] I31f65b40c83f03c4e4b71a799aaea0359b992279

Closes-Bug: #1643749
Change-Id: I910214ae0228439c18f10b0b5a322af4fbcc9c2e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/30/404030/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # REVISIT(yamamoto): This method is a copy of the base class method, # with 'router_id' notification argument added. def _confirm_router_interface_not_in_use(self, context, router_id, subnet_id): subnet = self._core_plugin.get_subnet(context, subnet_id) subnet_cidr = netaddr.IPNetwork(subnet['cidr']) fip_qry = context.session.query(l3_db.FloatingIP) try: kwargs = {'context': context, 'subnet_id': subnet_id, 'router_id': router_id} registry.notify( resources.ROUTER_INTERFACE, events.BEFORE_DELETE, self, **kwargs) except exceptions.CallbackFailure as e: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): # NOTE(armax): preserve old check's behavior if len(e.errors) == 1: raise e.errors[0].error raise l3.RouterInUse(router_id=router_id, reason=e) for fip_db in fip_qry.filter_by(router_id=router_id): if netaddr.IPAddress(fip_db['fixed_ip_address']) in subnet_cidr: raise l3.RouterInterfaceInUseByFloatingIP( router_id=router_id, subnet_id=subnet_id)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 20:00:22.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/backend/cephfsnative.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-manila/commit/a80670eef48c5745c7c852f48482afc3166f64a1', 'message': "Update ceph.conf when setting manila ceph backend

Manila ceph driver reads ceph's client configuration
(keyring is the most important) from ceph.conf file
(or any other file set by cephfs_conf_path). ceph.conf

commit_message:
Update ceph.conf when setting manila ceph backend

Manila ceph driver reads ceph's client configuration
(keyring is the most important) from ceph.conf file
(or any other file set by cephfs_conf_path). ceph.conf
should be updated with keyring location.

Change-Id: I151d04646d8625f12448054abc42293bae42f431
Partial-Bug: #1644784
Closes-Bug: #1646147
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-manila refs/changes/01/405601/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $keyring_path = none, $client_mount_uid = 0, $client_mount_gid = 0, if $keyring_path { ceph_config { "client.${cephfs_auth_id}/keyring": value => $keyring_path; "client.${cephfs_auth_id}/client mount uid": value => 0; "client.${cephfs_auth_id}/client mount gid": value => 0; } }

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Switch ansible-role-zookeeper centos-7 non-voting

We were to quick to flip this job voting. We don't have a zookeeper
package for centos-7 yet.

Change-Id: I3f402cec4b4fc3a49d7ba4a359d22ed505c0d9c2
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
